rules: Rule1: If a scientist studies a phenomenon, then plastic causes pollution.
Rule2: Provided that a scientist publishes findings, pollution impacts wildlife follows.
Rule3: Whenever a researcher collects data, a scientist studies a phenomenon.
Rule4: Under the condition that a researcher analyzes data, a scientist publishes findings.

Rule5: Either a person testifies before the committee, or a person mobilizes the community, or if it is not the case that either legislation bans plastic or plastic is harmful, then legislation passes a subsidy.
Rule6: Either a person organizes a protest, or if it is not the case that if legislation amends a provision, then legislation passes a subsidy, then a process delays the vote.
Rule7: Provided that plastic causes pollution, legislation bans plastic.
Rule8: Under the condition that pollution impacts wildlife, plastic is harmful.
Rule9: If it is not the case that either legislation bans plastic or plastic is harmful, then legislation amends a provision.
Rule10: If it is not the case that either a researcher collects data or a researcher analyzes data, then a journal retracts a study.
facts: Fact1: Legislation does not ban plastic.
Fact2: A journal does not retract a study.
Fact3: Legislation does not pass a subsidy.
Fact4: A person does not mobilize the community.
Fact5: A person does not testify before the committee.
Fact6: A process does not delay the vote.
Fact7: A person does not organize a protest.
